conclusion: Analyze forces and interactions to determine block function and car's stopping point.
Blocks are on a green surface; car is in the lower right corner moving towards blocks and marble.
Car collides with red block first, displacing it and exerting force.
Car collides with blue block, displacing it and showing continued force.
Car collides with yellow block, displacing it and showing consistent force.
Car collides with blue cube again, but it doesn't move significantly.
Car is deflected by blocks and no longer in contact with them.
Car collides with marble, displacing it and exerting force.
Car will continue moving after colliding with marble due to its smaller size.
Car will stop if no other forces act on it; friction is primary slowing force.
Car will stop where green surface meets edge of frame due to lack of other forces.
Final answer: Car stops where green surface ends due to friction.
